definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: Life is tricky in a world without rules.
sentences.chinese: 如果一個世界沒有規則，生活就會亂套。

sentences.english: Then might mess up, first was the daughter goes home "to raise a rumpus ".
sentences.chinese: 這下可亂套了，首先是女兒回家“鬧翻了天”。

sentences.english: That makes it easier to switch gears without a meltdown.
sentences.chinese: 這使得變換活動更容易，而且不會亂套。

sentences.english: Many Americans think their legal system has gone haywire .
sentences.chinese: 很多美國人認爲他們的司法體系已經亂套了。

sentences.english: Meanwhile the New World is in turmoil….
A few seconds later, the whole system's in mayhem.
sentences.chinese: 幾秒鐘之後，整個系統全亂套了。

sentences.english: Wouldn't that turn society upside down?
sentences.chinese: 合法那社會不亂套了嗎？
